summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. The indictment alleges that from approximately 1994 to 1997, Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls as young as 14, and that she later committed perjury in a 2016 civil deposition by denying her knowledge and involvement.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting him in recruiting, grooming, and abusing victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Listed as the Acting United States Attorney and the foreperson signing the indictment.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together from at least 1994 to 1997 to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. Described as having a personal and professional relationship, being in an intimate relationship, and being among his closest associates.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the time period of the alleged conspiracy.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: The period during which Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor victims at various locations.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited massage to Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, during which the victim was topless, as part of the grooming process.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, denying knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
keyFacts: The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell with six federal crimes: one count of conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, one count of enticement of a minor, one count of conspiracy to transport minors, one count of transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

Maxwell is alleged to have played a central role in Epstein's abuse scheme from 1994-1997 by befriending, grooming, and normalizing sexual abuse for minor victims as young as 14, and by being present for and participating in sexual encounters.

Three specific minor victims are referenced (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3), detailing abuse occurring in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London, with Maxwell allegedly facilitating interstate and international travel for abuse.

The indictment alleges Maxwell committed perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying her knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, her awareness of sex toys, and her own actions such as giving massages.
The document establishes that Maxwell and Epstein had both an intimate personal relationship and a professional employer-employee relationship during the period of the alleged conspiracy.
